Donating $100 mill to Dolly Parton ‚Äî most beloved inclusive-yet-nonpartisan charity queen ‚Äî the same week as you lay off 10k employees is a hilariously brazen and goofy attempt at misdirection. "Courage & Civility Award"? really Jeff lol

For my first semester I had TA job assigned in advance, fortunately. When I arrived at the start of the Fall semester and found out I wouldn‚Äôt get my first pay check til November, I almost puked (and definitely cried). Grad students deserve better.

As an international student I couldn‚Äôt take out loans. My visa conditions meant I couldn‚Äôt work off campus for extra $$. During summers I had to fight for scant summer TA jobs, or go to Canada (where I have citizenship) to work. Higher UC pay would have been life-changing.

I moved to CA to attend a ‚Äúfully funded‚Äù MFA at UCSD. My monthly pay was $1200 or $1500 (no pay over summer) depending on my TA position. My rent was $500. I was worried sick about money the whole 3 years. Solidarity with everyone striking today üñ§‚ù§Ô∏èüêà‚Äç‚¨õ‚úä https://t.co/X983CyQVLC
